name: record-http
description: Records incoming HTTP calls for testing
readme:
# HTTP Request Recorder
[![Circle CI](https://circleci.com/gh/Originate/record-http.svg?style=shield)](https://circleci.com/gh/Originate/record-http) [![Dependency Status](https://david-dm.org/originate/record-http.svg)](https://david-dm.org/originate/record-http) [![devDependency Status](https://david-dm.org/originate/record-http/dev-status.svg)](https://david-dm.org/originate/record-http#info=devDependencies)
> records incoming HTTP calls

For black-box testing of network services.


## Usage

In your test suite, set up a listener:

```javascript
HttpRecorder = require('record-http')

listener = new HttpRecorder().listen(7777)
```

Now this instance records all calls made to port 7777.
Access the recorded calls through:

```javascript
listener.calls
```

More details around recording calls are [here](features/record.feature).
You can reset the recorded calls (and keep listening for more) via

```javascript
listener.reset()
```

An example is given [here](features/reset.feature).
Finally, close your instance through

```javascript
listener.close()
```

More details around closing are [here](features/close.feature).


## Development

See our [developer guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md)
